question: Which state police has launched a senior citizen safety initiative 'Savera'?
explanation: The Uttar Pradesh government has recently launched an all-encompassing emergency helpline number \'112\' to access police, fire brigade, ambulance and other services under the Emergency Response Support System. Beside this, the state police also launched a senior citizen safety initiative \'Savera\', wherein they would be able to call for help by dialling the emergency number \'112\'. The one-stop helpline will sport an additional feature for citizens above 70 years of age. The initiative is anchored by Dr Abhishek Shukla who will work in association with UP 112 services. The feature aims to provide security and care to those senior citizens whose children have left them and they live alone. The police will take care of them and address their needs.
